title: Manly youngster rushed to hospital
text:
Manly Sea Eagles youngster recovering in hospital after heart scare stopped game February 18, 2017 4:26pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS A MANLY teenager is recovering in hospital after an SG Ball match he was playing in against the Rabbitohs had to be temporarily stopped amid fears he was having a heart attack. 
Playing fullback for the Sea Eagles against South Sydney at Erskineville Oval today, Alan Tuigamala was treated for chest pains, with concerns around his welfare halting play for almost 20 minutes. 
According to a statement released by Manly this afternoon, Tuigamala was subsequently taken to Royal Prince Alfred Hospital for tests and is now “resting comfortably with his mother and girlfriend by his bedside”. 
“The Manly Sea Eagles will monitor Tuigamala’s condition closely and he will need to be medically cleared before he contemplates playing again,” the statement said. 
“There were some suggestions that he may have suffered a heart attack but subsequent tests seemed to indicate that was not the case. 
“Manly Warringah Sea Eagles will continue to update on his progress when possible.” View All Comments The latest sports news, in your inbox daily. Email
